content.description: Start close to the corner and work your way up. Pulling the lip is crux, especially without using the pillar directly ahead.Red line on the photo on coin slot.
content.location: Directly under the observation platform, to the right of the Nightcrawler crack.

content.description: The crux is close to the bottom as you pull on medium crimps. The lack of feet options make this climb harder at the start. Once you reach the largest crack there are solid fist and hand jams along with some delicate left footholds that are hard to find. Right foot can utilize the crack pretty comfortably.
content.protection: Pad or two, maybe a spotter to move a single pad
content.location: Start at the base of the observation rock.

content.description: Squeeze chimney or off-width practice. Short and sweet.
content.location: Directly below the observation platform in the backend of the gully between the two larger boulders on the upper side of this area.

content.description: Start as low as you can on the left lraning diagonal crack. Solid laybacking, juggy pulls, and foot jams up this short crack. The crux is transitioning from the face to the shabby side of the boulder. Avoid the smaller boulder that would make an amazing foot hold and reach high.
content.protection: Two pads, one for each side. Shrubs might be enough in the summer
content.location: When facing the vertical sheet side of the biggest boulder, locate the leftmost crack on that face.

content.description: Transitioning from the start to the hand crack midway up. Named after the crack that runs through the boulder. Watch for spiders and trash.
content.location: Back of the gulley and right of the observation platform.

content.description: Climb up the blunt and bulging arete to the top. Some fun footwork. Matched hands on a rail to start.
content.location: The boulder to the right of the observation boulder.

content.description: Slightly overhanging edgy wall. Good for outdoor campus practice, albeit with a poor landing.
content.location: In the divide between the upper boulders

content.description: Conglomerate rock outcropping that is under the electrical lines at Rocky Ridge. Very sunny spot but the climbs get shadier as the day goes on.
